00075 /*  Internal structure for tracking location of items 
00076     in the XML file.
00077 */
00078 struct TiXmlCursor
00079 {
00080     TiXmlCursor()       { Clear(); }
00081     void Clear()        { row = col = -1; }
00082 
00083     int row;    // 0 based.
00084     int col;    // 0 based.
00085 };

00170     // Table that returs, for a given lead byte, the total number of bytes
00171     // in the UTF-8 sequence.
00172     static const int utf8ByteTable[256];

00186     static const char*  SkipWhiteSpace( const char* );
00187     inline static bool  IsWhiteSpace( char c )      
00188     { 
00189         return ( isspace( (unsigned char) c ) || c == '\n' || c == '\r' ); 
00190     }
00191

00199     /*  Reads an XML name into the string provided. Returns
00200         a pointer just past the last character of the name,
00201         or 0 if the function has an error.
00202     */
00203     static const char* ReadName( const char* p, TIXML_STRING* name );
00204 
00205     /*  Reads text. Returns a pointer past the given end tag.
00206         Wickedly complex options, but it keeps the (sensitive) code in one place.
00207     */
00208     static const char* ReadText(    const char* in,             // where to start
00209                                     TIXML_STRING* text,         // the string read
00210                                     bool ignoreWhiteSpace,      // whether to keep the white space
00211                                     const char* endTag,         // what ends this text
00212                                     bool ignoreCase );          // whether to ignore case in the end tag
00213 
00214     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data ) = 0;
00215 
00216     // If an entity has been found, transform it into a character.
00217     static const char* GetEntity( const char* in, char* value, int* length );
00218 
00219     // Get a character, while interpreting entities.
00220     // The length can be from 0 to 4 bytes.
00221     inline static const char* GetCharUTF8( const char* p, char* _value, int* length )
00222     {
00223         assert( p );
00224         *length = utf8ByteTable[ *((unsigned char*)p) ];
00225         assert( *length >= 0 && *length < 5 );
00226 
00227         if ( *length == 1 )
00228         {
00229             if ( *p == '&' )
00230                 return GetEntity( p, _value, length );
00231             *_value = *p;
00232             return p+1;
00233         }
00234         else if ( *length )
00235         {
00236             strncpy( _value, p, *length );
00237             return p + (*length);
00238         }
00239         else
00240         {
00241             // Not valid text.
00242             return 0;
00243         }
00244     }
00245 
00246     // Puts a string to a stream, expanding entities as it goes.
00247     // Note this should not contian the '<', '>', etc, or they will be transformed into entities!
00248     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_OSTREAM* out );
00249 
00250     static void PutString( const TIXML_STRING& str, TIXML_STRING* out );
00251 
00252     // Return true if the next characters in the stream are any of the endTag sequences.
00253     // Ignore case only works for english, and should only be relied on when comparing
00254     // to Engilish words: StringEqual( p, "version", true ) is fine.
00255     static bool StringEqual(    const char* p,
00256                                 const char* endTag,
00257                                 bool ignoreCase );

00286     // None of these methods are reliable for any language except English.
00287     // Good for approximation, not great for accuracy.
00288     static int IsAlphaUTF8( unsigned char anyByte );
00289     static int IsAlphaNumUTF8( unsigned char anyByte );
00290     inline static int ToLowerUTF8( int v )
00291     {
00292         if ( v < 128 ) return tolower( v );
00293         return v;
00294     }
00295     static void ConvertUTF32ToUTF8( unsigned long input, char* output, int* length );

00606     }

00612         name = _name;

00615         prev = next = 0;

00623         value = _value;

00626     }

00658     }

00661     {

00663         SetValue( buf.buffer ? buf.buffer : "error" );  
00664     }
00665     #endif

00671

00675

00677         Attribtue parsing starts: first letter of the name
00678                          returns: the next char after the value end quote
00679     */
00680     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data );
00681 
00682     // [internal use]
00683     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00684 
00685     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00686     // [internal use]
00687     // Set the document pointer so the attribute can report errors.
00688     void SetDocument( TiXmlDocument* doc )  { document = doc; }
00689 
00690 private:
00691     TiXmlAttribute( const TiXmlAttribute& );                // not implemented.
00692     void operator=( const TiXmlAttribute& base );   // not allowed.
00693 
00694     TiXmlDocument*  document;   // A pointer back to a document, for error reporting.
00695     TIXML_STRING name;
00696     TIXML_STRING value;
00697     TiXmlAttribute* prev;
00698     TiXmlAttribute* next;
00699 };

00701 
00702 /*  A class used to manage a group of attributes.
00703     It is only used internally, both by the ELEMENT and the DECLARATION.
00704     
00705     The set can be changed transparent to the Element and Declaration
00706     classes that use it, but NOT transparent to the Attribute
00707     which has to implement a next() and previous() method. Which makes
00708     it a bit problematic and prevents the use of STL.
00709 
00710     This version is implemented with circular lists because:
00711         - I like circular lists
00712         - it demonstrates some independence from the (typical) doubly linked list.
00713 */
00714 class TiXmlAttributeSet
00715 {
00716 public:
00717     TiXmlAttributeSet();
00718     ~TiXmlAttributeSet();
00719 
00720     void Add( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00721     void Remove( TiXmlAttribute* attribute );
00722 
00723     TiXmlAttribute* First() const   { return ( sentinel.next == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.next; }
00724     TiXmlAttribute* Last()  const   { return ( sentinel.prev == &sentinel ) ? 0 : sentinel.prev; }
00725     TiXmlAttribute* Find( const char * name ) const;
00726 
00727 private:
00728     TiXmlAttribute sentinel;
00729 };
00730 
00731 
00736 class TiXmlElement : public TiXmlNode
00737 {
00738 public:
00740     TiXmlElement (const char * in_value);
00741 
00742     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00743 
00744     TiXmlElement( const std::string& _value ) :     TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::ELEMENT )
00745     {
00746         firstChild = lastChild = 0;
00747         value = _value;
00748     }
00749     #endif
00750 
00751     virtual ~TiXmlElement();
00752 
00756     const char* Attribute( const char* name ) const;
00757 
00764     const char* Attribute( const char* name, int* i ) const;
00765 
00772     const char* Attribute( const char* name, double* d ) const;
00773 
00781     int QueryIntAttribute( const char* name, int* value ) const;
00783     int QueryDoubleAttribute( const char* name, double* value ) const;
00784 
00788     void SetAttribute( const char* name, const char * value );
00789 
00790     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00791     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name ) const              { return Attribute( name.c_str() ); }
00792     const char* Attribute( const std::string& name, int* i ) const      { return Attribute( name.c_str(), i ); }
00793 
00795     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, const std::string& _value ) 
00796     {   
00797         StringToBuffer n( name );
00798         StringToBuffer v( _value );
00799         if ( n.buffer && v.buffer )
00800             SetAttribute (n.buffer, v.buffer ); 
00801     }   
00803     void SetAttribute( const std::string& name, int _value )    
00804     {   
00805         StringToBuffer n( name );
00806         if ( n.buffer )
00807             SetAttribute (n.buffer, _value);    
00808     }   
00809     #endif
00810 
00814     void SetAttribute( const char * name, int value );
00815 
00819     void SetDoubleAttribute( const char * name, double value );
00820 
00823     void RemoveAttribute( const char * name );
00824     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00825     void RemoveAttribute( const std::string& name ) {   RemoveAttribute (name.c_str ());    }   
00826     #endif
00827 
00828     TiXmlAttribute* FirstAttribute() const  { return attributeSet.First(); }        
00829     TiXmlAttribute* LastAttribute() const   { return attributeSet.Last(); }     
00830 
00831     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returs it.
00832     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00833     // [internal use]
00834 
00835     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00836 
00837 protected:
00838 
00839     // Used to be public [internal use]
00840     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00841         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00842     #endif
00843     virtual void StreamOut( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00844 
00845     /*  [internal use]
00846         Attribtue parsing starts: next char past '<'
00847                          returns: next char past '>'
00848     */
00849     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data );
00850 
00851     /*  [internal use]
00852         Reads the "value" of the element -- another element, or text.
00853         This should terminate with the current end tag.
00854     */
00855     const char* ReadValue( const char* in, TiXmlParsingData* prevData );
00856 
00857 private:
00858     TiXmlElement( const TiXmlElement& );                // not implemented.
00859     void operator=( const TiXmlElement& base ); // not allowed.
00860 
00861     TiXmlAttributeSet attributeSet;
00862 };

00900 class TiXmlText : public TiXmlNode
00901 {
00902     friend class TiXmlElement;
00903 public:
00905     TiXmlText (const char * initValue) : TiXmlNode (TiXmlNode::TEXT)
00906     {
00907         SetValue( initValue );
00908     }
00909     virtual ~TiXmlText() {}
00910 
00911     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00912 
00913     TiXmlText( const std::string& initValue ) : TiXmlNode (TiXmlNode::TEXT)
00914     {
00915         SetValue( initValue );
00916     }
00917     #endif
00918 
00919     // [internal use]
00920     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth ) const;
00921 
00922 protected :
00923     // [internal use] Creates a new Element and returns it.
00924     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
00925     virtual void StreamOut ( TIXML_OSTREAM * out ) const;
00926     // [internal use]
00927     bool Blank() const; // returns true if all white space and new lines
00928     /*  [internal use]
00929             Attribtue parsing starts: First char of the text
00930                              returns: next char past '>'
00931     */
00932     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data );
00933     // [internal use]
00934     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
00935         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
00936     #endif
00937 
00938 private:
00939     TiXmlText( const TiXmlText& );              // not implemented.
00940     void operator=( const TiXmlText& base );    // not allowed.
00941 };

01056 class TiXmlDocument : public TiXmlNode
01057 {
01058 public:
01060     TiXmlDocument();
01062     TiXmlDocument( const char * documentName );
01063 
01064     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01065 
01066     TiXmlDocument( const std::string& documentName ) :
01067         TiXmlNode( TiXmlNode::DOCUMENT )
01068     {
01069         value = documentName;
01070         error = false;
01071     }
01072     #endif
01073 
01074     virtual ~TiXmlDocument() {}
01075 
01080     bool LoadFile();
01082     bool SaveFile() const;
01084     bool LoadFile( const char * filename );
01086     bool SaveFile( const char * filename ) const;
01087 
01088     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01089     bool LoadFile( const std::string& filename )            
01090     {
01091         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01092         return ( f.buffer && LoadFile( f.buffer ));
01093     }
01094     bool SaveFile( const std::string& filename ) const      
01095     {
01096         StringToBuffer f( filename );
01097         return ( f.buffer && SaveFile( f.buffer ));
01098     }
01099     #endif
01100 
01103     virtual const char* Parse( const char* p, TiXmlParsingData* data = 0 );
01104 
01109     TiXmlElement* RootElement() const       { return FirstChildElement(); }
01110 
01116     bool Error() const                      { return error; }
01117 
01119     const char * ErrorDesc() const  { return errorDesc.c_str (); }
01120 
01124     const int ErrorId() const               { return errorId; }
01125 
01133     int ErrorRow()  { return errorLocation.row+1; }
01134     int ErrorCol()  { return errorLocation.col+1; } 
01135 
01156     void SetTabSize( int _tabsize )     { tabsize = _tabsize; }
01157 
01158     int TabSize() const { return tabsize; }
01159 
01163     void ClearError()                       {   error = false; 
01164                                                 errorId = 0; 
01165                                                 errorDesc = ""; 
01166                                                 errorLocation.row = errorLocation.col = 0; 
01167                                                 //errorLocation.last = 0; 
01168                                             }
01169 
01171     void Print() const                      { Print( stdout, 0 ); }
01172 
01173     // [internal use]
01174     virtual void Print( FILE* cfile, int depth = 0 ) const;
01175     // [internal use]
01176     void SetError( int err, const char* errorLocation, TiXmlParsingData* prevData );
01177 
01178 protected :
01179     virtual void StreamOut ( TIXML_OSTREAM * out) const;
01180     // [internal use]
01181     virtual TiXmlNode* Clone() const;
01182     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01183         virtual void StreamIn( TIXML_ISTREAM * in, TIXML_STRING * tag );
01184     #endif
01185 
01186 private:
01187     TiXmlDocument( const TiXmlDocument& copy );
01188     void operator=( const TiXmlDocument& copy );
01189 
01190     bool error;
01191     int  errorId;
01192     TIXML_STRING errorDesc;
01193     int tabsize;
01194     TiXmlCursor errorLocation;
01195 };

01278 class TiXmlHandle
01279 {
01280 public:
01282     TiXmlHandle( TiXmlNode* node )                  { this->node = node; }
01284     TiXmlHandle( const TiXmlHandle& ref )           { this->node = ref.node; }
01285     TiXmlHandle operator=( const TiXmlHandle& ref ) { this->node = ref.node; return *this; }
01286 
01288     TiXmlHandle FirstChild() const;
01290     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const char * value ) const;
01292     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement() const;
01294     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const char * value ) const;
01295 
01299     TiXmlHandle Child( const char* value, int index ) const;
01303     TiXmlHandle Child( int index ) const;
01308     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const char* value, int index ) const;
01313     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( int index ) const;
01314 
01315     #ifdef TIXML_USE_STL
01316     TiXmlHandle FirstChild( const std::string& _value ) const               { return FirstChild( _value.c_str() ); }
01317     TiXmlHandle FirstChildElement( const std::string& _value ) const        { return FirstChildElement( _value.c_str() ); }
01318 
01319     TiXmlHandle Child( const std::string& _value, int index ) const         { return Child( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01320     TiXmlHandle ChildElement( const std::string& _value, int index ) const  { return ChildElement( _value.c_str(), index ); }
01321     #endif
01322 
01324     TiXmlNode* Node() const         { return node; } 
01326     TiXmlElement* Element() const   { return ( ( node && node->ToElement() ) ? node->ToElement() : 0 ); }
01328     TiXmlText* Text() const         { return ( ( node && node->ToText() ) ? node->ToText() : 0 ); }
01330     TiXmlUnknown* Unknown() const           { return ( ( node && node->ToUnknown() ) ? node->ToUnknown() : 0 ); }
01331 
01332 private:
01333     TiXmlNode* node;
01334 };
